executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Cheese producers endured a slight dip in revenue through the end of 2024, despite slightly higher per capita dairy consumption and boosting milk prices. Despite high sales amid strengthening milk prices, cheese production revenue and profit have been pressured by rising operational costs, including input purchase and labor costs. Nonetheless, cheese producers' revenue loss over the last five years was minimal because cheese is an essential part of the American diet. Another contributing factor to low revenue contraction was heightened per capita disposable income that encouraged some consumers to trade up on cheese products. Overall, revenue is expected to inch down at a CAGR of 0.4% over the past five years to $62.6 billion, including a 0.4% contraction in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Milk Price Increases Limit Revenue Contraction
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Milk prices surged because of supply shortages and growing demand following the food service sector's reopening in 2021 and 2022. This compelled cheese producers to raise their selling prices. Despite the price hikes, consumers largely maintained their cheese purchases, as it remains a staple in American diets, showcasing the strong inelastic demand for cheese. Although revenue contracted, heightened selling prices helped to somewhat offset the increased operating costs, which cushioned the revenue drop. Despite profit drops over the past five years, these boosted prices limited revenue decline.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Innovation Is Vital for High Performance
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Cheese producers have incorporated cheese blends, such as Kraft's 'Mexican Four Cheese,' which includes cheddar, asadero, Monterey jack and queso quesadilla cheeses, catering to consumers making Mexican-inspired dishes. Producers have developed reduced-fat and light cheese options as an alternative to full-fat cheese for health-conscious consumers. These varieties cater to those seeking to lower their calorie and fat intake while still enjoying cheese.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Domestic Consumption Is Set to Decline
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: US per capita dairy consumption weakens, preventing stronger expansion of cheese production revenue. This dip in dairy consumption limits any boost in the price of fluid milk, leading to stagnating or even pushing down domestic selling prices of various cheese products across the country, affecting both small and large-scale producers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New Opportunities Will Support Revenue Expansion
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers develop tastes for specialty artisan cheese varieties imported from Western European countries, including France, Italy, the Netherlands, and Spain.

industry_definition: Cheese producers manufacture cheese products from raw milk and processed milk products through various methods such as pasteurization, fermentation and aging. These processes create a wide range of cheese varieties, textures and flavors.

opportunities: Demand from supermarkets and grocery stores

key_trends: Cheese producers compete on quality, taste, price and value.
Effective branding and marketing also play crucial roles in distinguishing their products in the market

market_segmentation.segment_description: The retail market encompasses various outlets, including supermarket chains, mass merchandisers, convenience stores, independent retailers, warehouse clubs, independent cheese dealers, specialty shops, online platforms, farmer's markets and discount stores.
Client enterprises in this market segment process cheese products further to produce various items such as frozen dinners, cheese sauces, cheese snacks and other value-added products.
The wholesaler market segment includes sales of cheese products to wholesalers, restaurants and hotels.

products_and_services.product_description: American cheeses include cheddar, Colby and cheese curds. Cheddar accounts for the most significant portion of this segment, prized for its versatility and rich, sharp flavor that improves with aging.
Italian cheeses include mozzarella, provolone, parmesan and ricotta cheeses. Mozzarella claims the top position in cheese production and per capita consumption.
Other cheeses include cream cheese, Neufchatel, French cheese, Swiss cheese, Hispanic cheeses like queso fresco, brick cheese, Muenster, Feta.

tier_1_suppliers: Animal Food Production in the US
Water Supply & Irrigation Systems in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Commercial Building Construction in the US
Electric Power Transmission in the US
Coal & Natural Gas Power in the US
tier_1_buyers: Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
tier_2_buyers: Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from supermarkets and grocery stores
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Supermarkets and grocery stores purchase cheese from manufacturers to sell to consumers. When demand is low, retailers reduce their cheese orders, causing a drop in revenue for producers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from food services and drinking places
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Restaurants, bars and food service establishments actively buy cheese products for their menus.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The United States is a net exporter of cheese, with imports fulfilling less than 5.0% of domestic demand in 2024.
As domestic demand heightens, cheese imports will endure very minimal growth.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region, known for its fertile land and abundant dairy farms, hosts the largest number of cheese producers in the United States.
Some of the largest population centers in the country are located in the Mid-Atlantic region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Federal standards set the composition of the product, including labeling requirements.
The expanding level of cheese trade means that cross-border regulation is becoming more pertinent to cheese producers.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Regulatory barriers arise from agencies like the FDA that enforce stringent standards.
Small producers often struggle to establish a national distribution network.

basis_points.basis_description: Cheese producers compete on quality, taste, price and value.
Producers must provide reliable customer service.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Cheese production is often contained to specific regions.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The primary driver of purchase costs include the price of raw milk.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Setting up cheese production requires significant capital investment.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Cheese is a staple food, ensuring consistent demand.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Producers are exploring milk alternatives due to rising vegan diets.

FAQs.question: Do your sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Trends in cheese consumption will follow movements in per capita dairy consumption.

FAQs.question: Is your company located near key end markets?
FAQs.answer: Cheese producers near end markets will exhibit lower transportation costs.
